title: 0.101010... in base 3?
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In base ten,  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(0.\overline{10}) =\frac{10}{99}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What about in base three?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(0.\overline{10})_3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"? "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Give your answer to 3 decimal places in base 10."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Notation:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":"  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0.\overline{10} = 0.10101010101010\ldots "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The subscripts indicate the base."}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here are two ways to approach this one:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1) "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(0.101010...)_3 = \frac{1}{3^1} + \frac{1}{3^3} + \frac{1}{3^5} + ...  = \frac{3}{8} = \boxed{0.375}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2) Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = (0.101010...)_3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"100_3 x = (10.101010...)_3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"100_3 x - x_3 = 10_3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"22_3 x = 10_3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = \frac{10_3}{22_3} = \frac{3_{10}}{8_{10}} = \boxed{0.375}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

I'll add it to the notation section. "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Can u please clear my doubts.

body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many binary strings of length 10 are palindromes?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Details and assumptions","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A "},{"type":"text","text":"palindrome","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" is a number that reads the same forward as it does backward. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A "},{"type":"text","text":"binary string","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" is a sequence of integers that are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The "},{"type":"text","text":"length","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" of a string refers to the number of integers in it."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"As an explicit example, the binary string of length "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 000, 001, 010, 011"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"100, 101, 110, 111 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

title: 0123456789 question
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"John proposes that the number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0123456789"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has the following rules:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1) If it is multiplied by a positive integer n, then the product uses the digits 0 to 9 only once."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2) If "},{"type":"text","text":"n is a multiple of 3","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":", then Rule 1 "},{"type":"text","text":"does not apply","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":". Otherwise, Rule 1 applies."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3)The product has at least 10 digits. Any product that has less than 10 digits will have 0s added to the front until it reaches 10  digits."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Because he's a jerk, you want to prove him wrong. So, you search for a counterexample to his proposal. You are finding the smallest possible integer that disproves his proposal."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Does such a integer exist? If it does, what is it? If it doesn't, answer 0."}]}]}
